main event: A circular white object, resembling a weather balloon, was sighted at Scott AFB, Illinois on October 7, 1953.
interesting points: The object was stationary for about 3-4 minutes before quickly moving in a NNW direction,The angular velocity of the object was estimated to be approximately 5 degrees,The observer initially thought it was a weather balloon, but later considered its altitude too high for that,Two pilots on the runway witnessed the object and reported it,The weather conditions were cool with scattered clouds and no wind.
witness description: Two military personnel, including a Flight Commander and a Second Lieutenant.
